metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4496 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in libstagefright in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted samplemetadata in an MPEG-4 video file, a related issue to CVE-2015-1538.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
